page.title: 04Memorial to Lord Herbert
page.content: There is a large bronze plaque in the rock above the harbour which was erected in memory of Lord Herbert of Lea, Secretary of State for war during the reign of Queen Victoria. It reads :{"In rememberance of Sydney, Fisrt {Lord Herbert of Lea, born 1810 died {1861. Twice Secretary of State for {War".}Who was the first member of the government to perceive the necesity of protecting the shores of the Firth of Forth from the inroads of hostile cruisers and for this purpose took steps for the fortification of the island of Inchkeith. He was the steadfast supporter of Florence Nightingale and the firm friend of the soldiers of the British Army.{"This {Memorial is erected by the trustees of {Robert Mackay Smith, Merchant Leith, {in accordance with the provisions of {his will."
